parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma2

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Broken Commands
</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Positions

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Sets the object position. The pos array uses the [[PositionASL]] format. The version of the command does not offset based on object center. 
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Warning </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> This command was deactivated and has no effect. Use [[setPosWorld]] instead.</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> obj [[setPosASL2]] pos

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> obj: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> pos: [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[private]] _aslPos = [[getPosASL]] [[player]];
_aslPos set [1, _aslPos [[select]] 1 + 10];
[[player]] [[setPosASL2]] _aslPos;</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[setPosWorld]] [[getPosWorld]] [[setPosASL]] [[getPosASL]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class='command_description'>
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on 21 Aug, 2013</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:‎Killzone_Kid|‎Killzone Kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
This command appears to do nothing in both Arma 2 and Arma 3. Tested on 21-08-2013.
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
